title: How to Make Lavender Linen Water

steps.headline: Pour the ingredients together into a suitable container.
steps.description: A spray container makes a good choice, as it will be ready to use rather than having to transfer it to another container.

steps.headline: Let sit for a week before using.
steps.description: Over time the water will continue to ferment, infusing the lavender fragrance. Shake occasionally during infusion.

steps.headline: Use within the following year.
steps.description: Add a label denoting both product and date to make it easier to know the remaining shelf life. Store in a cool place out of direct sunlight. The fragrance deteriorates with time.

steps.headline: Use the lavender linen water to add a pleasing fragrance to linens that are being stored.
Apply in either of the following ways:
steps.description: Spray: Pour into a spray bottle and spray directly onto the linen while ironing. Iron: Pour a little into the iron and use the steam function.

steps.headline: Spritz linen prior to using it.
steps.description: While optional, this is a nice use for freshening linen. When removing linen from the cupboard for use, especially bedding, give a quick spritz with this water to freshen it. This is especially nice for pillow cases.

tyn: Glass or plastic container with lid (sprayer optional but helpful)
Funnel for pouring liquids into the container
